DOC.brief_summary: The investigators hypothesized that very lenient rate control is not inferior to strict or lenient rate control assessed by implantable continuous ECG monitor for preventing cardiovascular hospitalization and mortality in patients with long-standing persistent or permanent atrial fibrillation
DOC.brief_title: Rate Ventricular Control Therapy in Patients With Permanent Atrial Fibrillation
DOC.criteria: Longstanding persistent or permanent atrial fibrillation Mean resting heart rate > 80 beats per minute with or without rate control medication Age < 70 years old Constant use of anticoagulation therapy Paroxysmal or persistent atrial fibrillation Nonstable heart failure or > III NYHA FC Indications for IPG/CRT/ICD Thyroid dysfunction Inability to walk or bike.
